HTMLAreaElement.summary: The HTMLAreaElement interface provides special properties and methods (beyond those of the regular object interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating the layout and presentation of {{HtmlElement("area")}} elements.

HTMLAreaElementCoords.summary: The coords property of the interface specifies the coordinates of the element's shape as a list of floating-point numbers. It reflects the {{htmlelement("area")}} element's coords attribute.

remarks.para: If the shape is rect, the shape is a rectangle and the string value's four comma separated numbers specify the coordinates of the top-left and bottom-right corners of the rectangle. For example, 0,0,200,20 defines the coordinates as 0,0, which is the top-left of the image map, and 200,20, which is 200px from the left and 20px from the top of the top-left corner of the image map.
If the shape is circle, the three comma-separated numbers represent the x and y coordinates of the circle's center and the radius.
If the shape is poly, the string consists of at least 6 comma-separated numbers representing at least 3 pairs of coordinates that define the vertices of the polygon.
For all coordinates, the origin is the top-left corner of the map element's image.

HTMLAreaElementCoords.value: A string; composed of a comma separated series of numbers.

HTMLAreaElementTarget.summary: The target property of the interface is a string that indicates where to display the linked resource.

remarks.para: It reflects the target attribute of the area element.

HTMLAreaElementTarget.value: A string representing the target. Its value can be:

HTMLAreaElementReferrerPolicy.summary:
The
HTMLAreaElement.referrerPolicy
property reflect the HTML referrerpolicy attribute of the
area element defining which referrer is sent when fetching the
resource.
HTMLAreaElementReferrerPolicy.value: A string; one of the following:

HTMLAreaElementAlt.summary: The alt property of the interface specifies the text of the hyperlink, defining the textual label for an image map's link. It reflects the {{htmlelement("area")}} element's alt attribute.

remarks.para: The alt value must be text that, when presented with the alt text of the other <area> hyperlinks within the same map, along with the alt text of the img itself, provides the user with the same kind of choice as the hyperlink would when used without its text but with its shape applied to the image.

If the {{htmlelement("area")}} is a link (contains an property), the alt property value should be a non-empty string giving the label for the link that would be appropriate if the image were unavailable. The alt attribute for a link <area> can only be empty if there is another <area> element in the same <map> that points to the same resource and has a non-blank alt attribute.

-Good alt text, bad alt text â€” Making your content perceivable on WCAG.com (2021)
-An alt decision tree on W3C Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI)

HTMLAreaElementSearch.summary: The search property of the interface is a search string, also called a query string, that is a string containing a "?" followed by the parameters of the <area> element's href. If the URL does not have a search query, this property contains an empty string, "".

remarks.para: This property can be set to change the query string of the URL. When setting, a single "?" prefix is added to the provided value, if not already present. Setting it to "" removes the query string.
The query is Percent-encoding when setting but not percent-decoded when reading.

Modern browsers provide
URLSearchParams
and
URL.searchParams
to make it easy to parse out the parameters from the query string.

HTMLAreaElementPathname.summary:
The HTMLAreaElement.pathname property is a
string containing an initial '/' followed by the path of
the URL not including the query string or fragment (or the empty string if there is no
path).

remarks.para: The pathname is Percent-encoding when setting but not percent-decoded when read.

HTMLAreaElementOrigin.summary: The origin read-only property of the interface returns a string containing the Unicode serialization of the origin of the <area> element's href.

remarks.para: The exact structure varies depending on the type of URL:
For all other cases, the string "null" is returned.

HTMLAreaElementShape.summary: The shape property of the interface specifies the shape of an image map area. It reflects the {{htmlelement("area")}} element's shape attribute.
HTMLAreaElementShape.value: A string; rect, circle, or poly.

HTMLAreaElementHost.summary: The host property of the interface is a string containing the host, which is the , and then, if the {{glossary("port")}} of the URL is nonempty, a ":", followed by the of the URL. If the URL does not have a hostname, this property contains an empty string, "".

HTMLAreaElementToString.summary:
The HTMLAreaElement.toString() stringifier
method returns a string containing the whole URL. It is a read-only
version of .
HTMLAreaElementToString.returns: A string containing the element's complete URL.

HTMLAreaElementProtocol.summary: The protocol property of the interface is a string containing the protocol or scheme of the <area> element's href, including the final ":".

remarks.para: This property can be set to change the protocol of the URL. A ":" is appended to the provided string if not provided. The provided scheme has to be compatible with the rest of the URL to be considered valid.

HTMLAreaElementUsername.summary: The username property of the interface is a string containing the username component of the <area> element's href. If the URL does not have a username, this property contains an empty string, "".

remarks.para: This property can be set to change the username of the URL. If the URL has no or its scheme is file:, then setting this property has no effect.
The username is Percent-encoding when setting but not percent-decoded when reading.

HTMLAreaElementRelList.summary: The HTMLAreaElement.relList read-only property reflects the rel attribute. It is a live containing the set of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the {{HTMLElement("area")}} element and the current document.

remarks.para:
The property itself is read-only, meaning you can't substitute the
by another one, but the content of the returned list can be
changed.

-The equivalent property on a and link,
and .
-The very same list but as a space-separated tokens in a string:

HTMLAreaElementHref.summary:
The HTMLAreaElement.href property is a
stringifier that returns a string containing the whole URL, and allows
the href to be updated.

HTMLAreaElementRel.summary: The HTMLAreaElement.rel property reflects the rel attribute. It is a string containing a space-separated list of link types indicating the relationship between the resource represented by the area element and the current document.

remarks.para:
-The equivalent property on a and link,
and .
-The very same list but as tokens:

HTMLAreaElementPing.summary: The ping property of the interface is a space-separated list of URLs. When the link is followed, the browser will send {{HTTPMethod("POST")}} requests with the body PING to the URLs.

remarks.para: It reflects the ping attribute of the area element.

blockquote.para: This property is not effective in Firefox and its usage may be limited due to privacy and security concerns.

HTMLAreaElementPort.summary: The port property of the interface is a string containing the port number of the <area> element's href. If the port is the default for the protocol (80 for ws: and http:, 443 for wss: and https:, and 21 for ftp:), this property contains an empty string, "".

remarks.para: This property can be set to change the port of the URL. If the URL has no or its scheme is file:, then setting this property has no effect. It also silently ignores invalid port numbers.

HTMLAreaElementPassword.summary: The password property of the interface is a string containing the password component of the <area> element's href. If the URL does not have a password, this property contains an empty string, "".

remarks.para: This property can be set to change the password of the URL. If the URL has no or its scheme is file:, then setting this property has no effect.
The password is Percent-encoding when setting but not percent-decoded when reading.

HTMLAreaElementHash.summary: The hash property of the interface is a string containing a "#" followed by the fragment identifier of the <area> element's href. If the URL does not have a fragment identifier, this property contains an empty string, "".

HTMLAreaElementHostname.summary: The hostname property of the interface is a string containing either the {{glossary("domain name")}} or {{glossary("IP address")}} of the <area> element's URL. If the URL does not have a hostname, this property contains an empty string, "". IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are normalized, such as stripping leading zeros, and domain names are converted to IDN.
HTMLAreaElementHostname.value:
A string containing the domain of the URL associated with the area element.
It can be used as both a setter and getter.

HTMLAreaElementDownload.summary: The download property of the interface is a string indicating that the linked resource is intended to be downloaded rather than displayed in the browser. The value represent the proposed name of the file. If the name is not a valid filename of the underlying OS, browser will adjust it accordingly.

remarks.para: It reflects the download attribute of the area element.
